name: Digit Fern
description: Hemionitis arifolia, commonly known as Digit Fern or Heart Fern, is a terrestrial fern native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India, Sri Lanka, and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Pteridaceae family and features upright fronds (15-30 cm tall) with small, dramatic, heart-shaped to arrow-shaped, dark green leaves. The plant displays an upright growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest with its attractive heart-shaped fronds. It's popular among fern enthusiasts for its unique leaf shape.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Avoid direct sunlight - prefers bright indirect light
Brown edges indicate low humidity or underwatering
